Not really "Making a dasboard". This is just bolting a load of impossibly complicated pre-fabricated electronic modules together.
Car firms hardly make anything nowadays, they just assemble component manufacturers' products.in the 1970s, I went round Aston Martin's factory. They made a lot. Of course they had to buy in carburettors, fuel pumps, speedometers, brake callipers but they made the entire body and chassis, the entire engine and most of the suspension. Everyone of them were superb craftsmen. Nowadays, they are beholden to computers and component manufacturers for almost everything. When Henry Royce made his first car, almost every single component (including generator, fuel pump, brakes etc, we're all made in-house. That's how you maintain quality
